paper_abstract: We have developed a new, multi-material, piecewise linear interface reconstruction method that correctly locates the position of each material in the mesh cell and matches the required volume fractions with no material ordering required. This is different from other volume tracking interface reconstruction methods in which an improper material ordering may result in materials being incorrectly located within the cell. The new method utilizes a type of weighted Voronoi diagram, known as a power diagram, to reconstruct the interface from approximate material locations derived either from a particle model or quadrature formula. It works on structured and general polygonal grids, for an arbitrary number of materials and can be naturally extended to three dimensions. Published in 2007 by John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Material order-independent interface reconstruction using power diagrams
